page.title: 12Stock and Arable Farming
page.content: Stock and Arable farming is the second most common type of farming next to Hill and Upland farming in the area round Torphichen. Stock and Arable farms rear beef calves until they are fully grown and they sell them for a profit. There are quite a lot of different breeds these are Fresian, Aberdeen Angus, Limosin, Herefords and Charolais. The farmers also grow crops to feed the animals. They grow Barley, Hay, Wheat and Corn but they normaly grow more than they need so they can sell the extra for a profit. Most farmers prefer hedges and fences as a stock proof boundery. In this area it used to be all dry stane dykes but it cost to much too repair them nowadays at Â£7 a yard whereas fences cost only Â£3 a yard to erect.
